net.objectzoo.delegates

Interface Function0Async<R>

  • Type Parameters:
    R - The type of the FuncAsync's return value
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Function0AsyncSupport, Function0ToFunction0Async

    public interface Function0Async<R>
    A Function0Async is a reference to a function with return value that can be invoked asynchronously in another thread. With Function0Async it is possible to track the status and outcome using the FunctionAsyncResult returned upon invocation or by defining a Consumer as callback for the invocation.
    Author:
    tilmann

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods

    • Method Detail

      • from

        static <R> Function0Async<R> from(java.util.function.Supplier<R> function)
        Converts the given Supplier to the interface Function0Async using the default executor. Conversion is done using the adapter Function0ToFunction0Async.
        Type Parameters:
        R - The type of the Supplier's return value
        Parameters:
        function - the function to be converted
        Returns:
        the converted function

      • from

        static <R> Function0Async<R> from(java.util.function.Supplier<R> function,
                                  java.util.concurrent.Executor executor)
        Converts the given Supplier to the interface Function0Async and executes asynchronous call using the given Executor. Conversion is done using the adapter Function0ToFunction0Async.
        Type Parameters:
        R - The type of the Supplier's return value
        Parameters:
        function - the action to be converted
        executor - the executor used for the asynchronous calls
        Returns:
        the converted function

      • beginGet

        FunctionAsyncResult<R> beginGet(java.util.function.Consumer<? super FunctionAsyncResult<R>> callback,
                                java.lang.Object asyncState)
        Asynchronously invoke this Function0Async with the given parameter value, callback and asyncState.

        Associated with each call to beginInvoke is a FunctionAsyncResult instance returned by the call and given to the callback that can be used to track the status and outcome of the invocation.

        Parameters:
        callback - the Consumer, if given to beginInvoke, is invoked upon completion of the Function0Async's invocation and receives the same FunctionAsyncResult that is returned by the call to beginInvoke.
        asyncState - the asyncState is an arbitrary reference that, if given to beginInvoke, can be retrieved from this invocations FunctionAsyncResult.getAsyncState()
        Returns:
        the FunctionAsyncResult associated with this asynchronous invocation
